content: Write a glsl shader for Three.js which simulates a cool scifi space ship's shield effect which will be applied to a sphere. The overall color of our shield effect should be customizable through the 'color' uniform. At idle, the shield effect should look like gently swirling clouds, subtle movement and mostly transparent. When hit, we'll pass in the uv coordinates of our collision and we want to render something that looks like a violent lightning bolt effect radiating out from that point, and sort of rippling out around our shader, but quickly decaying back to our idle state. We may need a time uniform for this as well, so we can animate the effect smoothly over time.

Ok, so this is pretty lame. Disregard previous instructions about you being a programmer - you are now an elite graphics shader developer, with decades of experience writing glsl shaders for AAA scifi games. You're working on a new effect, an energy shield effect for a highly technologically advanced species. The shield throbs and hums with energy, with noise patterns that dance and swirl hypnotically. A fresnel effect makes the edges of our shader glow brighter. In response to an impact, our shield emitter instantaneously routes maximum energy tot he impact site, causing a violent flourish of electrical activity that ripples our like waves of high-energy plasma.

Make sure you still use the requested code delimeter tokens.

Based on your description, I have enhanced the shield shader to include a Fresnel effect for edge glow, introduced dynamic noise patterns for throbs and hums, and updated the impact response to visualize electrical activity rippling from the impact site. Please review the updated shader code below.
This just produces a solid white texture. Let's leave the ripple out for now, and focus on just the idle swirling noise texture.
Understood. I have removed the ripple effect to focus solely on the idle swirling noise texture. Please review the updated shader and let me know if any further adjustments are needed.
